definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: On hearing their teacher's voice, the pupils stopped talking at once.
sentences.chinese: 一听到西席的声音，门生们立即竣事发言。

sentences.english: He gave his daughter in marriage to his favourite pupil.
sentences.chinese: 他把女儿嫁给了他的得意门生。

sentences.english: On his birthday, his students wanted to give him a party.
sentences.chinese: 一次逢王的生日，他的门生想给他祝寿。

sentences.english: He also has several favorite students.
sentences.chinese: 他还有几位得意门生呢。

sentences.english: Sacramento State can call him their most famous dropout.
sentences.chinese: 萨克拉门托州立小学称他是该校最著实的停门生。

sentences.english: Many students can't even read, not to mention write, traditional full-form Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 很多门生乃至不能欣赏繁体汉字，更别提誊写了。

sentences.english: In schools, there are more than 50% of the population has tried marijuana at least once.
sentences.chinese: 在中学里，赶过50%的门生至少试过一次年夜麻。

sentences.english: The student tried very hard become successful as doctors , teachers or scientists.
sentences.chinese: 门生非常积极成为乐成的大夫，西席或科学家。

sentences.english: Since the Eastern Han Dynasty has been disciples Guli, multiphase and erection Songde.
sentences.chinese: 自后汉以来，门生故吏，多相与立碑颂德。

sentences.english: And of course, the best nightclubs have the biggest velvet ropes and the pickiest doormen.
sentences.chinese: 最好的夜总会有着最大的天鹅绒拦绳和最挑剔的门生。

definition: direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
to offer a libation/person who performs the libation before a banquet/senior member of a profession/important government post in imperial China
